newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end down on speculative selling.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end down on speculative selling.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Monday mainly on selling by speculators in select blue chips and dealers said overall trading remained lacklustre and sentiment mixed on new accounts day.
The Karachi 100-share index fell 10.95 points, or 0.76 percent, to end at 1,431.17. Losers led gainers 165 to 79.
"Trading was dull today as major players stayed out because of political and economic uncertainty," dealer Sajjad Mankani said. "Sentiment is confused and the market lacks direction."
PTCL fell 0.40 rupees to 35.60 and Lever Brothers 4.0 to 681. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
